articles.author: JULIE CARR SMYTH, JILL COLVIN, COLLEEN LONG, MICHAEL BALSAMO, ERIC TUCKER and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: BUTLER, Pa. (AP) — Former President Donald Trump was the target of an apparent assassination attempt Saturday at a Pennsylvania rally, days before he was to accept the Republican nomination for a third time.
articles.title: Trump injured but 'fine' after attempted assassination at rally, shooter and one attendee are dead

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Donald Trump’s campaign says he is “fine” after what law enforcement officials are treating as an assassination attempt during a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.
articles.title: The Latest: Officials say man who opened fire at Trump rally was a 20-year-old from Pennsylvania

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: REHOBOTH BEACH, Del. (AP) — President Joe Biden said Saturday that “everybody must condemn” the suspected assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden says 'everybody must condemn' attack on Trump and later speaks with ex-president

articles.author: MICHAEL BIESECKER and MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: The U.S. Secret Service is investigating how a gunman armed with an AR-style rifle was able to get close enough to shoot and injure former President Donald Trump at a rally Saturday in Pennsylvania, a monumental failure of one the agency’s core duties.
articles.title: The Secret Service is investigating how a gunman who shot and injured Trump was able to get so close

articles.author: EVAN VUCCI and JULIE CARR SMYTH
articles.description: BUTLER, Pa. (AP) — At 6:02 pm Saturday, to the strains of “God Bless the U.S.A.,” former President Donald Trump took the stage at fairgrounds in Butler, Pennsylvania, waving at the cheering crowd and settling into his regular rally speech under a scorching midsummer sun.
articles.title: A few short minutes after Trump took the stage, shots rang out

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE and CHRISTINA A. CASSIDY
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Before Saturday’s apparent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, there have been multiple instances of political violence targeting U.S.
articles.title: Four US presidents were assassinated; others were targeted, as were presidential candidates

articles.author: MOHAMED JAHJOUH
articles.description: KHAN YOUNIS, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel said it targeted Hamas’ shadowy military commander in a massive strike Saturday in the crowded southern Gaza Strip that killed at least 90 people including children, according to local health officials.
articles.title: Israeli strike targets the Hamas military commander and kills at least 90 in southern Gaza

articles.author: DASHA LITVINOVA
articles.description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — When Maksim Kolker’s phone rang at 6 a.m., and the voice on the other end said his father had been arrested, he thought it was a scam to extort money. A day earlier, he had taken his father, prominent Russian physicist Dmitry Kolker, to the hospital in his native Novosibirsk, when his advanced pancreatic cancer had suddenly worsened.
articles.title: Treason and espionage cases are rising in Russia since the war in Ukraine began

articles.author: MELINA WALLING and JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: PORTER, Texas (AP) — Hurricanes cause trouble for everyone, but farmers have a whole other list of problems. Beryl has been no exception: Over the past week, the storm damaged crops, soaked rabbits and chickens, terrified goats, put horses at risk of developing colic and left cows without fences to keep them penned in.
articles.title: After Beryl, Houston-area farmers pull together to face unique challenges

articles.author: ANGELA CHARLTON
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Paris hosted an extra-special guest for France’s national holiday Sunday — the Olympic flame lighting up the city’s grandiose military parade for Bastille Day.
articles.title: France's Bastille Day parade meets the Olympic torch relay in an exceptional year
